definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: The stubborn Bull will have difficulties understanding the unpredictable side of you.
sentences.chinese: 变幻莫测的你很难被固执的牛儿理解。

sentences.english: Still, these are tense and unpredictable times in trade relations between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这都是两国间贸易紧张且变幻莫测的时期。

sentences.english: It can change colorful auspicious light follow the visual angle.
sentences.chinese: 可以随视角变幻出七彩祥光，魅力无穷。

sentences.english: My world fluctuates in you turns the head instantaneous.
sentences.chinese: 我的世界变幻在你回眸的瞬间。

sentences.english: He is a vaporous and shifting mirage.
sentences.chinese: 他像是一团雾，漂移不定，变幻莫测。

sentences.english: Where all of the walls all continually change.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宫墙都变幻莫测。

sentences.english: His temper's been changeable this week, so don't annoy him.
sentences.chinese: 这礼拜他脾气变幻无常，所以不要惹他负气。

sentences.english: Magician means a changeable stage full of masters.
sentences.chinese: 其意为变幻莫测，高手云集的舞台。

sentences.english: The mystic clouds drift in and out, changing the scenery from minute to minute.
sentences.chinese: 神奇的云海漂进漂出，风景时时刻刻变幻莫测。

sentences.english: No matter what changes take place in the international situation, this policy will not change.
sentences.chinese: 无论国际风云如何变幻，这一政策都不会改变。

sentences.english: THAILAND’S recent political history has been, to put it mildly, volatile.
sentences.chinese: 泰国近年的政治，说得婉转些，是风云变幻。

sentences.english: Pandemics, like the viruses that cause them, are unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 同造成大流行的病毒一样，大流行变幻莫测。

sentences.english: I used to lie on the floor and watch the changing scenery.
sentences.chinese: 我习惯赖在地上看著这变幻无穷的风景。

sentences.english: This is a changing and unpredictable century.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个变幻难测的世纪。

sentences.english: Eckhoff, Angela, 2011 The arts consist of variation of appreciation.
sentences.chinese: 艾勒夫安吉拉，2011年指出艺术是变幻的欣赏。

sentences.english: The heavens change every moment, and reflect their glory or gloom on the plains beneath.
sentences.chinese: 天空变幻无穷，映呈着下界的盛衰枯荣。

definition: to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
intermittent/now you see it, now you don't
